19  
20  package org.elasticsearch.cache.recycler;
21  
22  import com.google.common.base.Strings;
23  import org.elasticsearch.ElasticsearchIllegalArgumentException;
24  import org.elasticsearch.common.component.AbstractComponent;
25  import org.elasticsearch.common.inject.Inject;
26  import org.elasticsearch.common.recycler.AbstractRecyclerC;
27  import org.elasticsearch.common.recycler.Recycler;
28  import org.elasticsearch.common.settings.Settings;
29  import org.elasticsearch.common.util.BigArrays;
30  import org.elasticsearch.common.util.concurrent.EsExecutors;
31  import org.elasticsearch.threadpool.ThreadPool;
32  
33  import java.util.Arrays;
34  import java.util.Locale;
35  
36  import static org.elasticsearch.common.recycler.Recyclers.*;
37  
38  /** A recycler of fixed-size pages. */
39  public class PageCacheRecycler extends AbstractComponent {
40  
41      public static final String TYPE = "recycler.page.type";
42      public static final String LIMIT_HEAP = "recycler.page.limit.heap";
43      public static final String WEIGHT = "recycler.page.weight";
44  
45      private final Recycler<byte[]> bytePage;
46      private final Recycler<int[]> intPage;
47      private final Recycler<long[]> longPage;
48      private final Recycler<Object[]> objectPage;
49  
50      public void close() {
51          bytePage.close();
52          intPage.close();
53          longPage.close();
54          objectPage.close();
55      }
56  
57      private static int maximumSearchThreadPoolSize(ThreadPool threadPool, Settings settings) {
58          ThreadPool.Info searchThreadPool = threadPool.info(ThreadPool.Names.SEARCH);
59          assert searchThreadPool != null;
60          final int maxSize = searchThreadPool.getMax();
61          if (maxSize <= 0) {
62              // happens with cached thread pools, let's assume there are at most 3x ${number of processors} threads
63              return 3 * EsExecutors.boundedNumberOfProcessors(settings);
64          } else {
65              return maxSize;
66          }
67      }
68  
69      // return the maximum number of pages that may be cached depending on
70      //  - limit: the total amount of memory available
71      //  - pageSize: the size of a single page
72      //  - weight: the weight for this data type
73      //  - totalWeight: the sum of all weights
74      private static int maxCount(long limit, long pageSize, double weight, double totalWeight) {
75          return (int) (weight / totalWeight * limit / pageSize);
76      }
77  
78      @Inject
79      public PageCacheRecycler(Settings settings, ThreadPool threadPool) {
80          super(settings);
81          final Type type = Type.parse(settings.get(TYPE));
82          final long limit = settings.getAsMemory(LIMIT_HEAP, "10%").bytes();
83          final int availableProcessors = EsExecutors.boundedNumberOfProcessors(settings);
84          final int searchThreadPoolSize = maximumSearchThreadPoolSize(threadPool, settings);
85  
86          // We have a global amount of memory that we need to divide across data types.
87          // Since some types are more useful than other ones we give them different weights.
88          // Trying to store all of them in a single stack would be problematic because eg.
89          // a work load could fill the recycler with only byte[] pages and then another
90          // workload that would work with double[] pages couldn't recycle them because there
91          // is no space left in the stack/queue. LRU/LFU policies are not an option either
92          // because they would make obtain/release too costly: we really need constant-time
93          // operations.
94          // Ultimately a better solution would be to only store one kind of data and have the
95          // ability to intepret it either as a source of bytes, doubles, longs, etc. eg. thanks
96          // to direct ByteBuffers or sun.misc.Unsafe on a byte[] but this would have other issues
97          // that would need to be addressed such as garbage collection of native memory or safety
98          // of Unsafe writes.
99          final double bytesWeight = settings.getAsDouble(WEIGHT + ".bytes", 1d);
100         final double intsWeight = settings.getAsDouble(WEIGHT + ".ints", 1d);
101         final double longsWeight = settings.getAsDouble(WEIGHT + ".longs", 1d);
102         // object pages are less useful to us so we give them a lower weight by default
103         final double objectsWeight = settings.getAsDouble(WEIGHT + ".objects", 0.1d);
104 
105         final double totalWeight = bytesWeight + intsWeight + longsWeight + objectsWeight;
106 
107         bytePage = build(type, maxCount(limit, BigArrays.BYTE_PAGE_SIZE, bytesWeight, totalWeight), searchThreadPoolSize, availableProcessors, new AbstractRecyclerC<byte[]>() {
108             @Override
109             public byte[] newInstance(int sizing) {
110                 return new byte[BigArrays.BYTE_PAGE_SIZE];
111             }
112             @Override
113             public void recycle(byte[] value) {
114                 // nothing to do
115             }
116         });
117         intPage = build(type, maxCount(limit, BigArrays.INT_PAGE_SIZE, intsWeight, totalWeight), searchThreadPoolSize, availableProcessors, new AbstractRecyclerC<int[]>() {
118             @Override
119             public int[] newInstance(int sizing) {
120                 return new int[BigArrays.INT_PAGE_SIZE];
121             }
122             @Override
123             public void recycle(int[] value) {
124                 // nothing to do
125             }
126         });
127         longPage = build(type, maxCount(limit, BigArrays.LONG_PAGE_SIZE, longsWeight, totalWeight), searchThreadPoolSize, availableProcessors, new AbstractRecyclerC<long[]>() {
128             @Override
129             public long[] newInstance(int sizing) {
130                 return new long[BigArrays.LONG_PAGE_SIZE];
131             }
132             @Override
133             public void recycle(long[] value) {
134                 // nothing to do               
135             }
136         });
137         objectPage = build(type, maxCount(limit, BigArrays.OBJECT_PAGE_SIZE, objectsWeight, totalWeight), searchThreadPoolSize, availableProcessors, new AbstractRecyclerC<Object[]>() {
138             @Override
139             public Object[] newInstance(int sizing) {
140                 return new Object[BigArrays.OBJECT_PAGE_SIZE];
141             }
142             @Override
143             public void recycle(Object[] value) {
144                 Arrays.fill(value, null); // we need to remove the strong refs on the objects stored in the array
145             }
146         });
147     }
148 
149     public Recycler.V<byte[]> bytePage(boolean clear) {
150         final Recycler.V<byte[]> v = bytePage.obtain();
151         if (v.isRecycled() && clear) {
152             Arrays.fill(v.v(), (byte) 0);
153         }
154         return v;
155     }
156 
157     public Recycler.V<int[]> intPage(boolean clear) {
158         final Recycler.V<int[]> v = intPage.obtain();
159         if (v.isRecycled() && clear) {
160             Arrays.fill(v.v(), 0);
161         }
162         return v;
163     }
164 
165     public Recycler.V<long[]> longPage(boolean clear) {
166         final Recycler.V<long[]> v = longPage.obtain();
167         if (v.isRecycled() && clear) {
168             Arrays.fill(v.v(), 0L);
169         }
170         return v;
171     }
172 
173     public Recycler.V<Object[]> objectPage() {
174         // object pages are cleared on release anyway
175         return objectPage.obtain();
176     }
177 
178     private static <T> Recycler<T> build(Type type, int limit, int estimatedThreadPoolSize, int availableProcessors, Recycler.C<T> c) {
179         final Recycler<T> recycler;
180         if (limit == 0) {
181             recycler = none(c);
182         } else {
183             recycler = type.build(c, limit, estimatedThreadPoolSize, availableProcessors);
184         }
185         return recycler;
186     }
187 
188     public static enum Type {
189         QUEUE {
190             @Override
191             <T> Recycler<T> build(Recycler.C<T> c, int limit, int estimatedThreadPoolSize, int availableProcessors) {
192                 return concurrentDeque(c, limit);
193             }
194         },
195         CONCURRENT {
196             @Override
197             <T> Recycler<T> build(Recycler.C<T> c, int limit, int estimatedThreadPoolSize, int availableProcessors) {
198                 return concurrent(dequeFactory(c, limit / availableProcessors), availableProcessors);
199             }
200         },
201         NONE {
202             @Override
203             <T> Recycler<T> build(Recycler.C<T> c, int limit, int estimatedThreadPoolSize, int availableProcessors) {
204                 return none(c);
205             }
206         };
207 
208         public static Type parse(String type) {
209             if (Strings.isNullOrEmpty(type)) {
210                 return CONCURRENT;
211             }
212             try {
213                 return Type.valueOf(type.toUpperCase(Locale.ROOT));
214             } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
215                 throw new ElasticsearchIllegalArgumentException("no type support [" + type + "]");
216             }
217         }
218 
219         abstract <T> Recycler<T> build(Recycler.C<T> c, int limit, int estimatedThreadPoolSize, int availableProcessors);
220     }
221 }
